newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Video link-up planned for Mir's Foale.
newsitem.headline: Video link-up planned for Mir's Foale.

text.p: U.S. astronaut Michael Foale will be able to chat with his family on Monday in a video link-up with the crippled Mir space station, officials at Mission Control said on Monday.
"Foale will speak to his familiy this evening," said Mark Severance, a NASA representative at Korolyov Mission Control outside Moscow.
"I have to brush my teeth before that," reporters heard Foale, a British-born NASA physicist, telling operators during a radio link-up with Mission Control on Monday morning.
Foale's colleagues, Russians Vasily Tsibliyev and Alexander Lazutkin, had a video link-up with Earth at the weekend.

Mir has been limping through space since a collision on June 25. The crew have been doing minor repairs but have not carried out the dangerous repairs needed to fully restore the power supply damaged in the accident.
Russian space officials have praised the crew's efforts but indicated the repair is likely to be done by a relief crew due to reach Mir on August 7.
Space officials and Mir designers were meeting on Monday to to make a final decision on the repairs.
Problems have plagued the mission since the accident, in which a module attached to Mir was holed during a manual docking manoeuvre.

After the accident an unidentified liquid leaked into space, Tsibliyev suffered a heart problem brought on by stress and Mir lost orientation for one day last week when one of the crew pulled out the wrong cable and a computer crashed.
